website_summaries.verdict: The best cake pop maker with a large cooking surface for high volume baking.
pros: Large, square baking plate has a nonstick surface for simple wipe downs after use
Molds perfectly shape round cake pops without the extra preparation of using an oven
cons: Cake pops often come out cracked and oddly shaped

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: SO glad I bought this versus making cake pops by hand. I was able to make over 100 cake pops in under 2.5 hours (non decorated of course). 2 tips to future users- use the recipes in the included booklet. There's less water and the consistency is PERFECT! And 2, use a ziplock bag with a corner cut out to fill the cake pop holes 3/4 way full for perfectly rounded pops!
customer_reviews.author: SchneiderCrew

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Makes Perfect Cake Pops
customer_reviews.text: My 18-year-old daughter has been into baking cupcakes, cake pops, and cakes for family friends birthdays. My one friend wanted a beach themed cake pops and my daughter had never made cake pops before so we did some research reading amazon reviews and found this cake pop maker that was affordable with good reviews. The cake pops turned out perfect; great shape and color to them. Does not make a lot of cake pops at once, but since it was easy to do we just made multiple batches and every cake pop turned out the same. Would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Torie

customer_reviews.title: Perfection and diversity in this little machine! Dessert and appetizer perfection!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little cake pop maker! I just made little brownie bites (crispy on the outside, fudgy in the middle). The brownie batter is too dense to make it perfectly round like the cake batter, but they still look adorable and are absolutely delicious! It heats up quickly, is easy to clean and is nice and tiny to store. You can make more than just cake pops. I found some great recipes for bite sized apperizers online (pizza balls, corn dog bites, cheesy bread balls, baby quiche, blueberry pancake bites...so many possibilities! Highly recommend, will be purchasing the larger one asap! Holidays are coming up, you must get this machine, it's made me smile all week.:))
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious bakers-good gift for kids
customer_reviews.text: I planned to make standard size cake pops in it. But, they’re tiny and most of them have a ridge on them where the top & bottom connect. It’s easy to use just don’t cook it quite as long as it says in the instructions. This was more like a toy or young bakers “appliance” than for serious use. I’m going to give it to a child who will likely get a lot of fun out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cake pop maker!!
customer_reviews.text: I sampled a couple cake pops before I added them to my son’s galaxy cake... they tasted amazing. And the cake pops made it possible for me to decorate the inside of his cake with a galaxy. The cake was a huge hit! It wouldn’t have been possible without the cake pop maker. It functioned exactly as the manual said, and was very easy to use. Everything was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: 6th Try is the Charm?
customer_reviews.text: Honestly! No!! NO! NO! NOOOOO! This thing need to come with freaking measurements for the pop compartments because it is not working....I will however give it one last try tomorrow to see if it works! Video explains it all! For now -1 Star
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I should read product descriptions better because it did say "mini"
customer_reviews.text: This thing is something that should be used for pre-school students. I should read product descriptions better because it did say "mini". I made some cake pops using these and they looked like two steps from being dum dum suckers. They are that small, these cannot be used for baby showers, weddings etc. But they are great for birthday parties for toddlers. I wish that I could send this thing back.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGirl

customer_reviews.title: POP SPARKS SMOKE
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars. I was so excited, I plugged it in and it went POP, sparks went everywhere and it started smoking. Sending back IMMEDIATLY.
customer_reviews.author: Miri

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this not..
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to getting this but when I opened the box it was broken. There's a big gap between the bottom and the top so heat escapes so you cannot get a good cake pop. It was also dirty like someone had used it before. What's up with this?
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I attempted multiple times to use this product and watched several you tube videos on how to use. Each time balls were uneven and extremely small. I ended up make the cake pops by hand. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Faith x3

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: We want to make cake pops and we were buying several times a week--this little machine was great --we used a triple chocolate mix and added coke--know we filled too full but the extra around cooks and lifts right off. Much better in this machine than the oven. The light would come on when finished. Next time we are going to use a recipe in back of book but were really pressed for time.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Stewart

customer_reviews.title: New to Cake Pops
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to make cake pops last weekend with my granddaughter. Now that was fun, and messy! And Fast... I do wish the plate could make more as we made one box of cake mix and felt like that would never run out as I kept making batch after batch of them for hours with a four year old getting wired on eating all the edges of the pops that I tore off the balls :) We will use this to make more at a later date. But I can say we got at least 10 batches of 9 pops out of a box. Which means, I have used this ten times in one day and it preformed well!
customer_reviews.author: THERESA

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy !
customer_reviews.text: I just received my cake pop maker today and as I opened my package there’s cake residue still in the machine I paid for a brand new cake pop maker and got a used one! With all the sickness going around this is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: The cake pops that come out when using this are about the size of a fifty cent piece or quarter. They're small but I expected that. The marker itself is small, compact, and easy to use. This cake pop maker is easy to clean and even easier to operate. I love that this even came with some recipes so I don't have to completely make something up on the spot and I did find that toying with the amount of liquid in boxed cake mix can make it a viable option to use in here as well.
customer_reviews.author: HFC

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: The paperwork/instructions recommend to cook cake pop for 4-5 minutes. I recommend 3.5 minutes. It gets VERY HOT so little hands will need to watch. I unplug it between each set because it gets hot. They also said to put a tablespoon of batter in each hole. I strongly recommend only a teaspoon. I'm in Colorado so maybe it's an altitude thing but a tablespoon was actually way too much. Highly recommend. Super easy. Very much like a waffle maker. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: BShip

customer_reviews.title: looks nice! Doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: looks nice! Doesn't work well! Over all it creates a lot of mess! Very hard to clean! Can't take it a part and wash everything. It doesn't cook evenly either so cake doesn't come out to be the perfect round balls like the picture!
customer_reviews.author: YWL

customer_reviews.text: Great product, does exactly what it says. This is perfect for making cake pops that aren’t as sweet as the ones at Starbucks. It also cut the time it takes to make a large batch significantly. If you’re looking for cake pops that aren’t as dense and sweet, or something to make donut holes, this is perfect! Super easy to use as well. The only downside is that this has to be hand cleaned and cannot be submerged in water whatsoever. This isn’t a big deal if you are okay with leaving a bit of an oily residue behind from nonstick sprays or oils.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: The hinges were very loose and wobbly on this pop maker, making it hard to close and latch. It cooked the pops unevenly, burnt on the bottom, and raw on the top. The directions said to use about a Tablespoon of batter, but that overflowed and made a mess, it takes about a teaspoon of batter. I tried a Butter Pecan cake mix with salted caramel icing, and the flavor was not good. I'm not sure if it was my flavor choice, or the machine, but the pops tasted like basic waffles. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: Barbe

customer_reviews.title: Fun little cake pop maker....
customer_reviews.text: Just got this mini cake pop maker today. The machine was small i was surprised. A little doubtful at first but somehow tried our first cake pop ever made and turned out to be very good as shown in the picture attached. Me and my daughter had fun with this little machine. Happy for the buy.
customer_reviews.author: From Washington

customer_reviews.title: Nice 👍🏾
customer_reviews.text: I’m a party planner and do a lot of sweets for clients I ordered this as a faster more convenient way to make cake pops I haven’t used it yet my 5 stars is based off quality it was packaged well, I opened plugged it up left it running for 30 minutes just to make sure it worked and wouldn’t stop and it get really really hot I have a client who ordered cake pops from me for October 26th 2019 that will be my first time using this product and I’ll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Volwin Ross

customer_reviews.title: WHO KNEW?
customer_reviews.text: WHAT A GREAT LITTLE DONUT MAKER...SO EASY TO USE!!!!! THE DONUTS ARE DELICIOUS. I BOUGHT TO MAKE AND HAVE A QUICK LAST MINUTE DESSERT FOR MY BINGO CLUB. THEY LOVE THE MOLD DONUTS I MAKE WITH WILTON MOLDS BUT SOMETIMES I AM CAUGHT OFF GUARD AND PRESSED FOR TIME. THIS IS A GOOD ITEM TO HAVE IN ADULT HOUSEHOLDS, TOO. A MONEY SAVER WHEN YOU THINK OF THE COST OF DONUTS BOUGHT AT OUTSIDE MARKETS. DELICIOUS...EASY. "BAKES" VERY WELL. EASY TO PORTION WITH A SPOON. WILL TRY TO MAKE THEM INTO JELLY DONUTS, TOO. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. VERY HAPPY WITH THIS.....CAME QUICKLY WELL PACKED
customer_reviews.author: Daleen Rose

customer_reviews.title: Made Some Cute Instruction Cards - Perfect for Kids!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cake pop maker for my mom to use with the grandkids. I thought it would be fun to make them some cute instruction cards for them to follow while using the cake pop maker. I am more than willing to send people the original for free so that you can print it out. I printed them out and laminated so that the kids could check the boxes with a dry erase marker. If you want a copy, email me at wvccrachel@gmail.com. Put in the subject line: Cake Pop Cards.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Owsley

customer_reviews.title: I love this product!
customer_reviews.text: My son and I were able to create tons of these mini baby cake pops. They are smaller than the average cake pop but, so very easy to use and clean. You can use regular cake batter and easily make 50+ from one cake mix box! We have used it quite a bit and and it is small and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They have so much fun with this item.
customer_reviews.text: They couldn't make enough batter and kept going giving cake pops to everyone. Now we have it more under control but it still a great item to pull out on a rainy or snowy or just cold day. they love sharing them with friends and family and coming up with new ideas. Great item to bond kids and parents and get them into kitchen and away from computer or phone.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy T.

customer_reviews.title: Great value appliance
customer_reviews.text: I looked for came pop maker for a while. This mini cake pop maker is not only cheap but also so easy to use. Although it doesn't have any temperature setting mode, it's on when plugging into outlet. It only took me 3-4 minutes to bake a cake pop. Because it's nonstick, it's very easy to clean up as well. I only use kitchen towel with sprayer water bottle to clean up. It's fun to make cake pops with kids when staying at home all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Yichu Su

customer_reviews.title: Good to make Hodu-gwaja (Korean Tradition cookie)
customer_reviews.text: Covid19 has increased the time cook with my kids at home. It is very useful when making mini cakes at home with children. Also It is nice to make Hodu-gwaja (Korean Tradition cookie) it is too expensive. 21 pcs price is 9.45 at cocohodo. This little machine already over worth it! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Youngsun Kim

customer_reviews.title: baby cakes cake pop maker
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would make the process of making Cake Pops Easier but it actually made it harder..the ball were not uniform in shape or size..you have to be super precise on how much batter to put in each cup..much easier to hand roll them Dont waste your time or money with this gadget
customer_reviews.author: stephen agnello

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift idea
customer_reviews.text: Great gift idea for expiring bakers of all ages. We ordered these as gifts for 8 and 6 year old and there grandmother wanted one too. Suggestion: if you purchase as a gift I suggest also ordering the sticks and some cake mix and toppings. If your buying for a child it will make it easier for them to just start using it without having to wait for their parents.
customer_reviews.author: Kelese23

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Only makes half of a ball that you'll need to attach afterwards. Followed directions to a T, yet never got a full ball. Difficult to remove and there's no spatula to help pull them out. Does heat up/cook fast, didn't burn batter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Hall

customer_reviews.title: Darling little machine perfect for bakers of all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nearly 10 year old daughter this past Christmas and she loves it. She's previously used an EZ bake oven but when I went to go buy refill packs I was disappointed with how expensive they are SO I started doing some research. This mini cake pop maker is perfect for her. It produces smaller than normal cake pops but it's super easy to use and even just using a box of cake mix yields a lot of little cake balls. How many you ask? Easily 50 maybe 100? They don't last long in our house. ;) My daughter has also successfully made pancake balls with this machine. So cute!
customer_reviews.author: JCPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fully cook through.
customer_reviews.text: Not good as I expected. I rather use my waffle maker to make the cubes, I will know those will be fully cooked. This pop maker won’t cook that good. Even I waited it heated up then poured the batter in and waited it for a long time. But still, the outside will be burned, but inside was not cooked. Not satisfy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Read what is included
customer_reviews.text: This item doesn't come with beginning batter mix or even pop sticks. I didn't read what it comes with. I had to purchase these items and look up recipes myself for my daughter. I wish it came with at these the sticks to start with. Otherwise a nice product. Cleaning isn't easy - the slats do not come off easily unless you use a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle B

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE, IF YOU HAVE KIDS!
customer_reviews.text: Must have for LITTLE KIDS! It makes more then cake. You could do pancake balls mini egg omlette bites...and more! Takes just minutes and super easy to use...my rule of thumb is filling the bottom reserves to the top to make sure they bake up into a ball! Has worked every time!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: This has so much potential
customer_reviews.text: Just got this. I mixed up cornbread batter from a Jiffy mix. They were yummy. My husband and I both liked them more then the cornbread or muffins. Not as crummy. Takes longer though. I got three batches at about 4 minutes each. When I put too much mix in, it was fine and cleaned up so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Conway

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I purchased this to go with a cake pop kit I purchased. This was very easy to use and cleaning was non existent...the pops come out clean and leave no mess. I love it! (You may want to use a squeeze bottle to make disbursement easier).
customer_reviews.author: KHaRT

customer_reviews.title: Great little cake pop maker!
customer_reviews.text: You can’t really give a cake pop MAKER stars for flavor, but, it doesn’t give the batter a funny taste, so we’ll give it 5 stars. This was my neice’s Christmas gift and couldn’t be happier with how happy she was making cake pops for everyone. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: ADraves

customer_reviews.title: Bleh
customer_reviews.text: They cooked way too fast and were sooo tiny. I would be better off rolling by hand or using a melon baller. This was a wasted purchase. By the time I used it was too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Fun time cooking with the kids
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to bake cake pop with the kids. If you guys are looking to spend time with the kids at home. Then you got to buy this. Baking with the kids is so much fun. Especially when they see the finish product. You can’t really make mistake with this. It’s easy as 1-2-3. Mix ingredients, bake and remove.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Great little cakes!!
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. I followed the recipe they gave. If you follow their recipe you will notice the batter is thicker than box cake mix. That's what makes these workout better. The cake pops are a little dry until you frost them. Once that's done they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 8-year old who loves to cook. We also purchased the Babycakes cake pop cookbook and have had a wonderful time testing out breakfast recipes. They cook up quickly and well. It's super easy to use and not difficult to wipe out when we're done.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pendrak

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the mini cake pop maker for my 6 year old birthday party and we loved it! Some reviews were complaining about the roundness of the pop. Mine were always perfect! I make them 4 times already and they were perfect ! I followed the chocolate recipe of the booklet, which was very good. I would recommend to buy the 100 re-usable sticks at the same time. The only difficult part is that you would need a stand to have the cake pop stored in your fridge. I made one out of a eggs carton box and it works well! Excellent gift for girl or for Valentines!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark & co

customer_reviews.title: Fine, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: In the end the flavor was very good but the recipes needed adjusting and the cooking times were off. The unit comes unevenly so we had to keep the ones in the back corner in a little longer. Our 8 yo loved it, especially the decorating part.
customer_reviews.author: Erin W.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: The new one is the right and the old one is the left. Horrible purchase. It gets super hot in less than 5 seconds and there’s no way to control them. They were black and still raw on the inside even when constantly checking them. I can’t get any contact info to get a replacement. This is very unprofessional.
customer_reviews.author: Karina Valencia

customer_reviews.title: My daughter and I love this baby cake maker! ❤
customer_reviews.text: I love this baby cake pop maker! It is easy to use. My daughter and I used it for the first time. She decorated them with melted chocolate and candy sprinkles. I don't expect it to deliver today (it came earlier) and my daughter wanted to make baby cake pop right away after I open it. I dont have much stuff to make it but the result is good. Hoping to make the decoration better the next time we make another baby cake pops.
customer_reviews.author: LoveBear

customer_reviews.title: cute and tiny
customer_reviews.text: wow! it's so cute and fun to play with. However, it is small but I think it's a good size ball for kids. I will get the bigger maker next
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: but this cake pop maker is very great for small batches (by small batches
customer_reviews.text: I made a bunch of cake pops for my baby shower, and since then everyones been trying to get me to make them for their occasions, unfortunately, it is kind of time consuming, but this cake pop maker is very great for small batches (by small batches, I mean like 2 boxes of cake mix--makes about 150 pops)cooks fast and its very easy to make perfect pops once you get he hang of it and find your rhythm!
customer_reviews.author: Janna

customer_reviews.title: They recommend
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend to do cake pops or little donut holes my kids love it when I use this for cake pops for birthday parties and events or just to make little donut holes but true because just to make bigger batches quicker and in less time
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Came used
customer_reviews.text: Was excited. But it came used and I bought new
customer_reviews.author: Tawney

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize how tiny these are. They are the size of a quarter. Rather pointless and look odd putting them on a stick.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Lea Langsdale

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited until I tried making my first batch and they didn’t turn out. It burns the outside and didn’t cook the inside at all. And it’s impossible to clean and get the greasy ness out of it cuz u can only hand wipe it down.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffanie

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Easy, Fun, YUM!
customer_reviews.text: Had Fun... Was quick and easy ..didnt use recipes that came with found 1 that worked with it and no sticking...Just fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: absolutely adorable
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great product! My wife loves this product. she said it makes cake pops very quickly while still tasting delicious and hallow in the middle so you are able to fill it. It’s very easy to clean, no assembly required, and it’s very “cute” looking so that’s a plus for big families! They taste amazing and make a lot. We made over 50+ little cake balls with some cake mix! I would definitely recommend trying this product out!
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working on the third use. Don’t waste your money. I had it plugged in to make donut holes and heard a pop and it wouldn’t heat up when plugged in any more. Find a better product elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Cooks evenly and cleanly.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this. Quick to make cake pops, and to clean. The light confused me at first, but that must meant it was ready to use and preheated fully. It cooks the batter evenly and quickly. The cake pops come out perfect each time.
customer_reviews.author: Hala

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: It works and is easy to use kind of. It said to scoop the cake balls out with some specific fork but it didn’t come with one. I had to roll the balls out and burned my fingers a few times. It’s super tedious to make more than a couple of batches
customer_reviews.author: Random gal

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me!! Too hard
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t do it as it showed on the videos, not able didn’t work for me, I was definitely not happy. I did three tries and my cake pops were a joke 🤪🤣. They were good but super small. 🤷🏻‍♀️🤷🏻‍♀️🤷🏻‍♀️🤷🏻‍♀️. They didn’t even ouff up noce and pretty.
customer_reviews.author: E.H

customer_reviews.title: Returning
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but would not cook half of it, left for the minutes on instructions even tried leaving in longer, tried turning them and nothing
customer_reviews.author: Bianey

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: The wholes are smaller than I expected. And I'm not sure it's the cake mix's problem or the machine. The taste is not that good and not really fluffy.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt cook even.
customer_reviews.text: It cooks unevenly the bottom gets too brown and the top is raw. Plus they're too small like the diameter of a silver dollar small. I knew they'd be mini but these are mini mini. I dont know if I got a dud but I didnt pay much for it so I'll just try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Just got it and I love it
customer_reviews.text: Just got this yesterday and couldn’t wait to try it. Made cake pops this morning and it was not only easy it was fun. Pops came out perfect. Plan on making donut holes soon. New favorite kitchen toy.
customer_reviews.author: MJ VanHecker

customer_reviews.title: Could be user error
customer_reviews.text: We are still learning how to use this. The cake balls didn’t come out as planned. We will keep trying though.
customer_reviews.author: amd3112

customer_reviews.title: No surprise it doesnt cook vegan batter good, nothing does.
customer_reviews.text: Vegan batter does not work well with this at all. Baking in an oven with vegan batter is tricky so it's no surprise this didnt make nice and fluffy cake pops. Once we try regular cake batter, I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Maacje

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth to buy for the price! Never been this easy to bake/make cake pops! 9 cakepops for 4mins! Awesome! Love it! I doubt myself before using it because of the price, to me was just cheap to actually work! But it works! Had a great times with kids making cakepops during this confused and boring staying home times for kids!
customer_reviews.author: Dahye Kang

customer_reviews.title: Sadly Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It came dirty with batter on the side and missing the tool to help get the cakes out. We were so excited to get it too! Couldn't return and get out with stay at home orders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I have used different types of batter (gluten free mochi batter, corn bread, fudge brownie) and it has held up every time! I always use cooking spray with it, but it does have durable non-stick coating. It is hand-clean only as the plates don't separate from the casing, but overall the cleaning process takes less than 5 minutes and only a wet paper towel. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for fun party treats!
customer_reviews.author: Bella Pineda

customer_reviews.title: It Literally Blew Up When We Plugged It In.
customer_reviews.text: Wife turns it on and SIZZZZZLE POP! SPARKS SMOKE. This crap should not be on the market, at all, for anyone, anywhere. Save your life and do not order this. We returned it.
customer_reviews.author: knowledge is power!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tween Gift
customer_reviews.text: Best gift ever for a tween who wants to bake. The recipes are easy and delicious, and the machine cleans up like a dream. Our new go to birthday gift!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: not fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to do with my grandaughter we followed all directions and everything would stick and the cakes were small and very light for no way a stick to put inside very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sad babycakes
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst item I’ve ever purchased. I bought it as a birthday present for my son and halfway through baking we just threw it away because of the quality of the cakes. They were sloppy looking and inconsistent. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Quit working during first use!!
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this, and for the 9 it made before completely quitting & not heating up anymore, they were delicious. My daughter was crushed as this was what she got from Santa. Can’t find any company contact info, and after it wouldn’t cook the batter for the second batch, hubs threw it away since it was such a complete mess. I would definitely hesitate purchasing this if you’re considering. Great concept, not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Em Bear

customer_reviews.title: Read the manual before use,do not be me🤣
customer_reviews.text: This device will deffinitely be responsible for ruining my body shape🤣Works well and easy to use.I liked the book with the recipes inside!!
customer_reviews.author: Olenka

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my ten year old and she really enjoyed it. She was able to do it herself after the first couple of batches. The cake cooks really fast. I'm wishing I would have bought the mini cupcake and donut maker as well...
customer_reviews.author: Kayleejo90

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite kitchen toy!
customer_reviews.text: Okay this has got to be my new favorite kitchen toy. Must spray with oil first. These little cake balls are so cute! Also cooks super fast!
customer_reviews.author: M.K.

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to the positive reviews. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my girlfriend's birthday as she loves baking. She loves it. Works great and made some awesome chocolate cake pops with it and used the sticks recommended from Amazon that are normally bought with this from other people and everything worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves it. I bought it and sent it to her because of the social distancing (we normally make things together) and she was so excited and loves to make cake pops.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to use and clean up. However, the cake is a little dry. I used less time than suggested and it was still dry. Makes a decent cake ball for the price.
customer_reviews.author: lauren lincoln

customer_reviews.title: It cooks quickly.
customer_reviews.text: So my only real issue with it, is that I wish it rotated. I have to turn it upside down for a second so the cake ball will come out round. But it cooks quickly so make sure you're watching otherwise you'll burn your cake balls. It's a good price. I like it. My daughter helps me make cake pops.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well for cake pops
customer_reviews.text: This did not work well for making cake pops and I wound up cooking the cake, crumbling, adding frosting and rolling them by hand. They kept falling off the stick when I dipped in the melted chocolate. would be good for making donut/cake holes though.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Quickest and easiest way to make cake pops ever Love this product because it brings my daughters and I together more often in the kitchen
customer_reviews.author: April A Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Makes cake pops
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old got this for her birthday, mixed up cake and had little cake pops 8 minutes later. They pop out really easily and are exactly as advertised. Only complaint is the machine is moderately difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: give babycakes a try!
customer_reviews.text: i love love love this!! made 120 cake pops in less than 3 hours. also, the recipe included in the product information is delish! i had the babycakes waffle maker and HATED it, this is a completely different story. non stick. easy clean up. fun fun fun!!! we love it. we use it tons.
customer_reviews.author: Andi J.

customer_reviews.title: Easy cake pop maker!
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier to make then cake balls, because you are "baking" the cake batter into a ball and not baking the cake then transforming it into a cake ball, don't expect to get the actual cake pop texture out of this. It makes perfect size cake ball so you can decorate it and not look bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Go for it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 10 year old and it’s easy to use. Fun activity during quarantine summer!
customer_reviews.author: CaliFam

customer_reviews.title: Small and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Cake pops easy to use small doesnt take up a lot of space if you are worried about counter space
customer_reviews.author: Tisha Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy for Cake Pop making
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget works great. Perfect little balls for my cakes pops. Loving it! ❤
customer_reviews.author: andra

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean
customer_reviews.text: Great product easy to clean. Simply wipe the product down. Cake pop comes out in a perfect ball!
customer_reviews.author: Rich’s

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cakepops in 4 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I always had a hard time learning to make cakepops, this little thing here is a miracle!! Perfect cakepops in 4 minutes! Follow the recipe in the book provided and you will be a pro! I love it so much, I make cakepops all the time now...Thank you for a goof-proof product!!
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Easy, convenient, and fun
customer_reviews.text: Love this cake pop maker! They're smaller than normal cake pops, but I think they're the perfect size for my toddler. The booklet has a few recipes to get you started. It heats up quickly, cooks in a few minutes, cleans easily, is non-stick and it's so small it doesn't take up much storage space.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: i’m not sure about this..
customer_reviews.text: If i’m being honest, making cake pops would taste better than making it on here. it was easy to use but it leaked every where so easily if you didn’t close it fast enough or put a little too much on there
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: They are wayyyyyyy too small. The only way you will get them the size you want is by overfilling them which causes them to overflow leading to a big mess which is just unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: Ericka

customer_reviews.title: Safe for Use In Dorms
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intention of hosting events in my dorm where I can make and share cake pops with residents. I hosted my first event today and this iron really made life easy! I was able to make dozens of cake pops very quickly and with little need for cleaning between batches. It's very easy to use -- no real risk of burning. I love this cake pop iron; it'll be a family heirloom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effortless Baking!
customer_reviews.text: this is an effortless way to make cake pops! a little time-consuming but they cook so quickly that time goes by so fast. by the time you’re finished with a box mix amount of pops, they’re ready for decorating. they taste great too without the added gooey-ness from DIY cake pops using frosting.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Franks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product - broke after first use! Vary dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: I got this so my daughter and I could make cakepops easily and use healthier ingredients. The first batch worked great. After the second batch it fell apart, the screws were broken and the part holding one of the sides broke completely off. I love this product, definitely want to get a replacement from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: yuliana

customer_reviews.title: Not as round cake pops
customer_reviews.text: I give it 2 stars because I got stressed the cake pops wouldn’t come out as round as the picture. They came out the shape of a ninja turtles head. Cake pops aren’t as big as traditional ones. I found it difficult to clean as cake got all over machine. Put oil on machine before putting cake otherwise cake pops will stick and break when trying to take them out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attempted
customer_reviews.text: I attempted once for my son birthday party and didn’t succeed so I haven’t used since
customer_reviews.author: Khaliredds

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Non stick good cake maker I do say the cake pops come out smaller then regular cake pops More for children or of you are looking for smaller cake pops and not standard size
customer_reviews.author: aracelis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mini cake balls
customer_reviews.text: This makes really great cake balls! And is surprisingly easy- my 9 year old uses it. It makes the small balls, like 1 inch. Bite size; Not the size you would see a regular cake pop at Starbucks or somewhere. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya R.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for young chef.
customer_reviews.text: Got for a young niece whose getting into cooking. Easy to use, fun.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Get your bake on!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a christmas gift for my daughters best friend. Its a very nice machine and very cute, makes 9 at a time!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad tool to have....
customer_reviews.text: This tool is not bad, but I am wondering if all store bought cake pops are this tiny??? It cools the cake fast, not bad for the price. My kids loves it!! We put funfetti cake batter and came out fluffy and delicious. Hope to get a lot use...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
